page.title: 14Laverstock Celebrates 40 yrs
page.content: On Bank Holiday Monday May 6th, in Beechcroft Road, a Street Party was organised to Celebrate 40 Years of Peace after the ending of the second World War. After a short service of thanksgiving, by the vicar, the celebrations began. Several came dressed up in the clothes of the time. Among them were soldiers, nurses and evacuees. There were games too. A Tug-of-war between neighbouring streets, wheelchair races and other children's games. After the games it was time to eat. There was enough food for everyone on the long trestle tables colourfully decked out with bunting and flags. Everyone had great fun and this was another example of the good community spirit among people.
